results.title: The Punter
results.brief_description: A short film about Jack Burnett and his involvment in the horse racing industry in the 1970s. (Jack is the father-in-law of the filmmaker) Identifiable with many students. Could be used for discussion on the idea of bought leisure and deals with gambling relating to horse racing.

results.title: Concerto for ads and heads
results.brief_description: A day in the life of one of Melbourne’s television stations, as filmed off the screen, one frame in every 10 seconds in 1979. A powerful observation of the content of ‘our box in the corner’ 20 years ago. Set to the music of Bach.

results.title: The Last wild river
results.brief_description: Covers an expedition in 1977 by four people including Bob Brown and Peter Thompson, down the wild Franklin River in Western Tasmania using rubber rafts. Shows much of the aesthetic and recreational value of this wilderness environment and introduces the conservation dispute focused on this area.

results.title: Aujourd'hui en France: trois jours trois, photographes
results.brief_description: One of a series of films covering various aspects of the French lifestyle, history and culture. This film studies three French photographers - Jean-Loup Sieff, Robert Doisneau, Bruno Barbey - and their different styles.

results.title: Mahatma and the mad boy
results.creator_credit: Ismail Merchant and Merchant Ivory Productions
results.brief_description: A comment on poverty and wealth filmed in Bombay, the central characters being the “mad” boy, his monkey and a statue of Mahatma Ghandi. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Christo: wrapped coast
results.brief_description: Examines the art event by Bulgarian artsist Christo, of wrapping a section of the Little Bay coastline near Sydney. As the wrapping progresses, the coastline takes on a glacial appearance, changes to a wrapped bundle, and is finally ripped apart by the force of the wind. Narrated by Kevin McCarthy, photographed and edited by Christian Blackwood.

results.title: The Artist and his craft: woodblock printer
results.brief_description: Follow the step-by-step execution of a woodblock print by artist Lowell Naeve from initial sketch to completed edition. Emphasises the unique qualities of the medium for creative expression.

results.title: Chemistry in nature
results.creator_credit: Educational Media Australia and Iwanami Film
results.brief_description: This film attempts to correct the view that chemistry only takes place in the laboratory. Two examples from Japan are used showing a volcanic lake found to be the most acidic in the world and the spectacular production of sulphur from gases emitted by volcanic vents. An explanation of the processes involved is demonstrated using laboratory equipment in the field. Discussion pauses are provided. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: High country children of New Zealand
results.creator_credit: Dave Gibson, Yvonne MacKay and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: Two children - Malcolm and Nerelli Prouting - live with their family on a sheep station in the isolated high country of south New Zealand. This film shows their daily lives from the excitement of mustering high up in the hills to mundane correspondence school work. Filmed on location at Mount Arrowsmith Station, New Zealand.
